description:
Life Simulator is a mathematical game that simulates a colony of single celled animals.  You, the user of the life simulator, input the initial location of single celled animals.  You then advance time to see the fate of your colony.
The game "Life" was invented in 1970 by the Cambridge University mathematician John Conway. 

Life Simulator lets the user control many features.  The 
image used to represent life, the speed at which time advances, as well as wrapping in the x and y dimensions are all configurable.  In this new version (1.1) of Life Simulator, the world is now 40 by 40 cells large letting you place
more interesting shapes like “Glider Guns” and “Pulsars”.  An initial
Life Pattern scene was also added to let you pick the initial life pattern,
Both the “Glider Gun” and “Pulsar” are included as predefined 
patterns you can select. You can also save your own favorite patterns.
